activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.002 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Estimation based on ''iron mine operation and iron ore benefication to 65% Fe, Qu√©bec 2011'' dataset (based on the extracted ore). 
Assumption : use of explosive Anfo.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
input_name: market for diesel, burned in building machine
comment: Calculated Value: Stands for the diesel consumption of the mobile equipment used for exploitation like drilling machines, scoop trams and underground trucks. Also, the infrastructure of the machines is included. See exchanges properties for details.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
input_name: market for diesel, burned in diesel-electric generating set, 10MW
comment: Calculated Value. See exchanges properties for details.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Calculated Value based on this estimation : the explosive Anfo is made of about 94 percent of ammonium nitrate and 6 percent of diesel.
Assumption : diesel low sulfur.

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Calculated Values based on the Environmental Impact Assessment and a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA).
Reported as anti-freeze. 
Raw data gives the amount of anti-freeze. It was assume a 60% ethylene glycol solution (% by volume), as its freezing point is -55 C (dilution water is neglected as it is marginal compared to the global amount of water consumed on site) (source :  http://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/ethylene-glycol-d_146.html).

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
comment:
Calculated value based on nickel, 99.5% dataset (ecoinvent v2).
ecoinvent v2 dataset:
extracted mineral: 110t
sand required: 45,6t
sand required per extracted mineral: 416kg/t

extracted mineral in Quebec mine:1279778 t
total required sand: 416*1279778=532387648kg

activity_name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
input_name: market for sulfidic tailings, from nickel mine operation
comment:
Calculated Value based on the Environmental Impact Assessment and a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA).  
The sulfidic tailings, off-site dataset is used as a proxy, composition of leachage to water may not fully correspond. For the modelled mine, sulfidic tailings remain on site. The landuse in the tailing dataset is much smaller than the one of the modelled mine. Landuse is hence directly added in this mine operation dataset.
